roleset.name: (cause to) drip, (causing to be) dropping small drips
roleset.note: DRIP-V NOTES: Frames file for 'drip' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 9.5. (from drip.01-v predicate notes)
DRIPPY-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, drip-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls pour-9.5. (from drippy.01-j)

example.name: all args
example.text: John dripped paint from the can into Mary's glass of tea.

example.name: ergative
example.text: Paint dripped from the can into Mary's glass of tea.

example.name: arg 2= non agentive dripper, argMs
example.text: Whether your costume involves black face and a noose , or whether it is a grilled sandwich where-1 I think the cheese is a little too drippy *-1 is irrelevant .

example.name: args 1, 2
example.text: Mr. Darcy's eyes looked drippy with clear liquid and his nose was drippy with yellowish mucous.

example.name: arg0 and somewhat dubious arg2
example.text: John was being drippy with his paintbrush while drunkenly painted the ceiling.

roleset.name: description of liquid
roleset.note: DRIP-V NOTES: Frames file for 'drip' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 9.5. (from drip.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: almost idiomatic?
example.text: ``A very striking illusion,'' Mr. Hyman says now, his voice dripping with skepticism, ``but an illusion nevertheless.''
